reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: Community-Led Monitoring of HIV Services in Multiple PEPFAR Countries

description.narrative: The purpose of Community-Led Monitoring (CLM) of HIV Services in Sierra Leone program is to use standardized data collection tools to conduct CLM of HIV services in PEPFAR service sites in Sierra Leone for dissemination throughout the country to promote improvements in the national HIV response. This CLM program will use client feedback collected by trained community members that reflects clients' experience in receiving HIV services in Sierra Leone in order to improve performance of PEPFAR service delivery and support stakeholder analysis with actionable insights. The goal of this program is to improve HIV care and services for a better client experience, and, ultimately, improve health outcomes through PEPFAR site and service monitoring.

reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Ebola Global Disease Detection - Stepped-Wedge Cluster Study (SWCS) of Ebola Vaccine Efficacy

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) advances science and health by providing access to biomedical and genomic information. In October 2014, CDC established a partnership with Sierra Leone to conduct an Ebola vaccine clinical trial, while a WHO-led international consortium began planning an Ebola ring vaccination trial in Guinea. The CDCSierra Leone trial, subsequently named STRIVE (Sierra Leone Trial to Introduce a Vaccine against Ebola), was led by the College of Medicine and Allied Health Sciences (COMAHS) of the University of Sierra Leone, the Sierra Leone Ministry of Health and Sanitation (MoHS), and CDC. The stepped-wedge cluster trial (SWCT) was a trial design proposed to test a candidate vaccine in Sierra Leone during the 2014 West Africa Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) outbreak.

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - Ebola Emergency Response in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) global health efforts are to assist Ministries of Health and other international partners to plan, manage effectively, and evaluate public health programs; achieve U.S. Government program and international organization goals to improve health, including disease eradication and elimination targets; expand CDC's global health programs that focus on the leading causes of worldwide mortality, morbidity and disability, including chronic disease and injuries; generate and apply new knowledge to achieve health goals; and, strengthen health systems and their impact.

reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: Health Systems Strengthening and HIV/AIDS Prevention, Care and Treatment under the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief: Resilient and Responsive Health Systems Initiative

description.narrative: The Resilient and Responsive Health Systems Initiative will support and enhance capacity in the primary health care system to address HIV/AIDS and other infectious diseases in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Liberia, Sierra Leone, and South Sudan. This program funds human resources for health, quality improvement and other health system strengthening activities in countries hit hardest by HIV/AIDS through the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR). Objectives include: (1) Training and technical assistance to build and strengthen care programs and health systems, so that affected countries can maintain programs over time and deliver quality HIV/AIDS care; build infrastructures such as clinic monitoring, health information systems, and medical and nursing education. (2) Enhance models of medical, nursing and midwifery education. (3) Develop partnerships between experts in the U.S. and people and institutions overseas to build skills and prepare host countries so that they may better manage their own programs over the long term.

title.narrative: Health Systems Strengthening and HIV/AIDS Prevention, Care and Treatment under the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief: Optimizing Momentum - Toward Sustainable Epidemic Control

description.narrative: OpCon: supports the integration of HIV testing, care, and prevention interventions currently or previously supported by PEPFAR into host country health systems through evaluation and technical assistance to ensure continued gains toward sustainable HIV epidemic control. This program funds human resources for health, quality improvement and other health system strengthening activities in countries hit hardest by HIV/AIDS through the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR). Objectives include: (1) Training and technical assistance to build and strengthen care programs and health systems, so that affected countries can maintain programs over time and deliver quality HIV/AIDS care; build infrastructures such as clinic monitoring, health information systems, and medical and nursing education. (2) Enhance models of medical, nursing and midwifery education. (3) Develop partnerships between experts in the U.S. and people and institutions overseas to build skills and prepare host countries so that they may better manage their own programs over the long term.
